segments.text: I see the woman meticulously polishing that plate, hands methodical and steady.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her focus is astounding; it’s like the world around her has vanished.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet, right at her feet, chaos is building, and she seems blind to it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about how children can be so sneaky and mischievous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is practically defying gravity, stretching to reach the cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And that girl, with her arm raised so expectantly, she really believes he will share.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scenario feels like a ticking clock, just waiting to explode.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she hears the water at all, splashing down with such force.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The open window gives a false sense of tranquility, while inside, it’s anything but.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she be so calm when the floor is turning into a mini lake?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I've seen situations like this before, and they never end well.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel a knot of tension in my stomach as I watch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s a sweet innocence in their mischief, yet it feels so wrong in this moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to believe that everything will be fine, but my instincts tell me otherwise.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a beautiful day outside, but the inside feels like a storm is brewing.
segments.speaker: PAR
